items.sentence: I don\'t think Tom would mind showing you how to do that.
I don\'t think Tom would try to do that without our help.
I don\'t think there is any way I can win this triathlon.
Tom did what he could in the short amount of time he had.
I couldn\'t sleep well last night, so I don\'t feel well.
Why are you wearing a raincoat? It\'s not raining, is it?
Why don\'t you come over to my house for dinner tomorrow?
I\'m not worried about Tom. I\'m worried about you, Mary.
I\'d like to sing a song for you that I wrote last night.
Tom couldn\'t tell Mary how to do what needed to be done.
Tom took a picture of his old camera with his new camera.
I asked Tom why he didn\'t want to go to the zoo with us.
If you go anywhere, you\'d better tell your mother first.
I think you should let Tom know that you don\'t like him.
We had a lot more fun in Boston than we thought we would.
We have more important things that need to be dealt with.
I\'ll do whatever it takes to keep my children in school.
I\'m going to make some coffee. Would you like some, too?
The last time I went to the beach, I got badly sunburned.
Tom was gunned down in the street in front of the church.
